citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Research staff did not give a protocol directed dose of analgesic to a dog on day two of the post operative period. The
dog was examined by the veterinarian on day one post operatively and noted to be non-painful and energetic, and
observed by facility staff on day 2 post op at am and pm room checks, as well as during a 30 minute play period, and no
pain was noted. Discontinuing or altering the IACUC approved schedule of post operative care is a significant change that
may lead to pain or distress, and does not allow for appropriate IACUC consideration and oversight of research
procedures. The facility must ensure that protocol directed treatments are given as directed, or changed only with
appropriate IACUC review and approval.
Correct from this date forward, December 12, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility personnel.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(7) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
Research staff did not give a protocol directed dose of analgesic to a dog on day two of the post operative period. The 
dog was examined by the veterinarian on day one post operatively and noted to be non-painful and energetic, and 
observed by facility staff on day 2 post op at am and pm room checks, as well as during a 30 minute play period, and no 
pain was noted. Discontinuing or altering the IACUC approved schedule of post operative care is a significant change that 
may lead to pain or distress, and does not allow for appropriate IACUC consideration and oversight of research 
procedures. The facility must ensure that protocol directed treatments are given as directed, or changed only with 
appropriate IACUC review and approval. 
 
Correct from this date forward, December 12, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility personnel.
